alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 8:47PM CDT until April 20 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LITTLE RIVER, NORTHWESTERN MILLER AND SOUTHEASTERN BOWIE COUNTIES... At 847 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Texarkana. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Red Lick, Mandeville, Genoa, Leary and Mount Pleasant. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
